headline.main: ONE DAY LATER FROM EUROPE,; ARRIVAL OF THE NORTH STAR. LATEST FROM THE SEAT OF WAR.

docs.lead_paragraph: The steamship North Star, WARMACK, from Havre Aug. 11, via Southampton, arrived at 3 o'clock yesterday morning, with dates from France and England to the afternoon of the 11th inst. The United States Mail steamship Arago arrived off Cowes, from New-York, on route to Havre, on the morning of the 10th.

headline.main: NEW-YORK CITY.; The Parodl Concert for the Norfolk Sufferesrs. Licensed Under the Maine Law. Politics vs. Policemeb., Curlosities. The City Census. The Prohibitory Law. Coroner's Investigations. Police News. SUPREME COURT--SPECIAL TERM.

docs.lead_paragraph: The Yellow Fever Periods. We have before us a record of the visitations of the yellow fever to the City of New-York and Philadelphia, from 1793 to 1822. The year last named was the last visitation of yellow fever to the City of New-York.
docs.snippet: The Yellow Fever Periods. We have before us a record of the visitations of the yellow fever to the City of New-York and Philadelphia, from 1793 to 1822. The year last named was the last visitation of yellow fever to the City of New-York.

headline.main: Progress of the Yellow Fever at Norfolk and Portsmouth--Exaggerations of the Panic Stricken--A Deserted City--Retreat of Apothecaries and Brokers--The Volunteer Nurses.

docs.lead_paragraph: NORFOLK, Thursday, Aug. 23, 1855-1 1/2 P.M. I regret that the telegraph is not in order, that I could transmit you the report of deaths and of the increase of fever cases, as my engagements are such as to leave me but little time for writing.
docs.snippet: NORFOLK, Thursday, Aug. 23, 1855-1 1/2 P.M. I regret that the telegraph is not in order, that I could transmit you the report of deaths and of the increase of fever cases, as my engagements are such as to leave me but little time for writing.

headline.main: EDUCATIONAL.; AMERICAN INSTITUTE OF INSTRUCTION. Twenty-sixth Annual Meeting.

docs.lead_paragraph: The twenty-sixth annual meeting of the American Institute of Instruction met to-day in this City, in the Universalist Church, which was well filled with teachers and others at an early hour. At 10 o'clock a meeting of thedirectors was held, at which the President, THOMAS SHERWIN, Esq., of Boston,

docs.lead_paragraph: SYDNEY SMITH, in spite of his reputation and habits as a diner-out, gives some very excellent advice on the subject of Temperance. In one of his letters he says he never knew a gentleman who ate or drank as little as was good for his health. In the following epistle to Lady HOLLAND he speaks still more decidedly in favor of abstinence from all fermented liquors;--his advice is sensible:

headline.main: NEW-YORK CITY.; Yellow Fever Infection. Board of Councilmen Committee on Charges. Charge of Corruption against Alderman Moser. Attempted Suicide. Editorial Amenities. Rescued from Drowning. Camphene Explosion. The Steamboat New World. Board of Supervisors. How Young Girls are Ruined. Police News. Coroner's Investigations. The Prohibitory Law.

docs.lead_paragraph: Rushton's New Remedy.--Fever and Agur?? never be judiciously trented with any one preparetion. A moment's reflection will convince any one that the different stages of the disease must require different remedies, one to beak up the chills; and another to effect a cure and restore the system to a state of health. It is the adoption of this principle which has given RUSHTON'S New Remedy the precedence over all others. RUSHTON'S, No. 10
